sanskrit_verse: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियाभ्यां तु दण्डः कार्यो विजानता । ब्राह्मणे साहसः पूर्वः क्षत्रिये त्वेव मध्यमः ॥ ८.२७६॥
transliteration: brāhmaṇakṣatriyābhyāṃ tu daṇḍaḥ kāryo vijānatā | brāhmaṇe sāhasaḥ pūrvaḥ kṣatriye tveva madhyamaḥ || 8.276 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a Brāhmaṇa or Kṣatriya knowingly transgresses Dharma, the appropriate response is structured according to their causal capacity—forceful intervention precedes for the Brāhmaṇa; balanced correction follows for the Kṣatriya.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is determined by consciousness capacity and spiritual station
Causation arises from awareness, not intent alone
Capacity-based responsibility assigns corrective action proportionally
Restoration logic aligns individual action with cosmic order
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor = Brāhmaṇa AND violation_known = true THEN initiate_sāhasa_protocol
IF actor = Kṣatriya AND violation_known = true THEN initiate_madhyama_danda_protocol
IF awareness_present = true THEN assign_restorative_path ELSE defer_to_guidance_system
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, when violations are committed with full knowledge by Brāhmaṇas or Kṣatriyas, precedence is given to immediate consciousness realignment for the former and proportional systemic correction for the latter. Responsibility thresholds are defined by ontological clarity, not social status.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that knowing violation activates sequential manifestation of consequence. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures the response aligns with the actor's causal field. Proportional responsibility reflects capacity-awareness correlation. Non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering does not restore Dharma—it is consciousness re-alignment that fulfills justice.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Sāhasa Protocol: Direct confrontation of distortion through authoritative truth-speaking to restore integrity in Brāhmaṇa
Enact Madhyama Danda Protocol: Balanced corrective engagement ensuring duty-responsibility alignment for Kṣatriya
Implement Awareness Restoration Sequence: Reconnect violator with source-consciousness through guided completion process
Execute Integrity Reintegration Cycle: Facilitate societal reacceptance upon demonstrated alignment with Dharma
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness remains the ultimate adjudicator.
